page.title: 07NATURE IN THE FORESTS
page.content: The soil is mainly sandy and of poor quality, but suitable for the planting of the pine forests carried out over the past sixty years or so. A small number of hardwood trees, mainly beech and oak,have been planted on the periphery of the forest, which adds to the attractiveness of the area, especially in the Autumn. WILDFILE The pine forests support a variety of woodland birds. Animals to be found there include the roe and red deer, the muntjac deer, foxes, badgers, rabbits and the grey squirrel. There is an abundance of wild flowers.
